column5:
Latest News: Authorities to lift COVID-19 entry restrictions for travelers from non-EU countries on 1 October (Schengen Visa Info,30.09.22)

International Restrictions:
*From within the EU: COVID-19 travel restrictions have been lifted in Luxembourg. Travellers do not need to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.

*Transit:

Transit through Luxembourg airport is allowed for all nationalities.



*From Third Countries:

Nationals of non-EU countries and territories can enter Luxembourg if they hold:

  • a residence permit or a residence permit for family members of an EU citizen
  • a right of residence or a national long-term visa.

 

Alternatively, they can enter if they meet one of the following conditions:

  • Proof of full vaccination

Validity: 9 months after the date when the vaccination pattern is considered completed and indefinitely for those with a third dose booster.

Accepted vaccines: BioNTech Pfizer / Comirnaty, Moderna / Spikevax, AstraZeneca / Vaxzevria, Jcovden (Janssen), Covishield (Serum Institute of India Pvt. Ltd (SII)), R-Covi (R-Pharm), Covid-19 vaccine (recombinant) (FIOCRUZ).

  • Proof of recovery from COVID-19

Validity: starts on the 11th day after the date of the first positive NAAT test result and ends at the latest 180 days after the given result.

  • They are residents of non-EU countries and territories that are not affected by temporary restriction on the external borders. These are listed on Visiting Luxembourg (FAQ).
  • Their travel is considered essential. The conditions are listed on Visiting Luxembourg (FAQ).

 

Please consult the FAQ section at Visiting Luxembourg for further details.

 

Learn more:

Luxembourg - Coronavirus


______________________

You can find the latest information on air travel regulations for this country on the IATA website.

You can also find information about your passenger rights on our portal for citizens.

Documents you need to travel in Europe
Health cover for temporary stays



Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Luxembourg: The Luxembourg government has now removed most COVID-19 restrictions. To find out more about local restrictions, please refer to the Luxembourg government website *If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
